rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)' is set to 'Enabled'

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees)' is set to 'Enabled'

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts' is set to 'Classic - local users authenticate as themselves'
rules.expected_value: Classic - local users authenticate as themselves
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts
rules.default_value: On domain-joined computers: Classic - local users authenticate as themselves. (Network logons that use local account credentials authenticate by using those credentials.) On stand-alone computers: Guest only - local users authenticate as Guest. (Network logons that use local accounts are automatically mapped to the Guest account.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Network Security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities' is set to 'Disabled'

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Network security: LDAP client encryption requirements' is set to 'Negotiate sealing' or higher
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: LDAP client encryption requirements

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Network security: LDAP client signing requirements' is set to 'Negotiate signing' or higher
rules.expected_value: Negotiate signing. has not been started, the LDAP BIND request is initiated with the LDAP data signing option set in addition to the caller-specified options. If TLS/SSL has been started, the LDAP BIND request is initiated with the caller-specified options.)
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: LDAP client signing requirements
rules.default_value: Negotiate signing. (If Transport Layer Security/Secure Sockets Layer (TLS/SSL) has not been started, the LDAP BIND request is initiated with the LDAP data signing option set in addition to the caller-specified options. If TLS/SSL has been started, the LDAP BIND request is initiated with the caller-specified options.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Require a password when a computer wakes (plugged in)' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\System\Power Management\Sleep Settings\Require a password when a computer wakes (plugged in)
rules.default_value: Enabled. (The user is prompted for a password when the system resumes from sleep while plugged in.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Offer Remote Assistance' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\System\Remote Assistance\Configure Offer Remote Assistance
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users on this computer cannot get help from their corporate technical support staff using Offer (Unsolicited) Remote Assistance.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Solicited Remote Assistance' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\System\Remote Assistance\Configure Solicited Remote Assistance
rules.default_value: Users can turn on or turn off Solicited (Ask for) Remote Assistance themselves in System Properties in Control Panel. Users can also configure Remote Assistance settings.

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable RPC Endpoint Mapper Client Authentication' is set to 'Enabled' (MS only)
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\System\Remote Procedure Call\Enable RPC Endpoint Mapper Client Authentication
rules.default_value: Disabled. (RPC clients will not authenticate to the Endpoint Mapper Service, but they will be able to communicate with the Windows NT4 Server Endpoint Mapper Service.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable Windows NTP Client' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\System\Windows Time Service\Time Providers\Enable Windows NTP Client
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The local computer clock does not synchronize time with NTP servers.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable Windows NTP Server' is set to 'Disabled' (MS only)
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\System\Windows Time Service\Time Providers\Enable Windows NTP Server
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The computer cannot service NTP requests from other computers.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow Microsoft accounts to be optional' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\App runtime\Allow Microsoft accounts to be optional
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users will need to sign in with a Microsoft account.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\AutoPlay Policies\Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices
rules.default_value: Disabled. (AutoPlay is enabled for non-volume devices.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Set the default behavior for AutoRun' is set to 'Enabled: Do not execute any autorun commands'
rules.expected_value: Enabled: Do not execute any autorun commands
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\AutoPlay Policies\Set the default behavior for AutoRun
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows will prompt the user whether autorun command is to be run.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off Autoplay' is set to 'Enabled: All drives'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\AutoPlay Policies\Turn off Autoplay
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Autoplay is enabled.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure enhanced anti-spoofing' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Biometrics\Facial Features\Configure enhanced anti-spoofing
rules.default_value: Users are able to choose whether or not to use enhanced anti-spoofing on supported devices.

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off cloud consumer account state content' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Cloud Content\Turn off cloud consumer account state content
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows experiences are able to use cloud consumer accounts.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off Microsoft consumer experiences' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Cloud Content\Turn off Microsoft consumer experiences
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users may see suggestions from Microsoft and notifications about their Microsoft account.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Require pin for pairing' is set to 'Enabled: First Time' OR 'Enabled: Always'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Connect\Require pin for pairing
rules.default_value: Disabled. (A PIN is not required for pairing to a wireless display device.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not display the password reveal button' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Credential User Interface\Do not display the password reveal button
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The password reveal button is displayed after a user types a password in the password entry text box. If the user clicks on the button, the typed password is displayed on-screen in plain text.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Credential User Interface\Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users will be required to always type in a username and password to elevate.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow Diagnostic Data' is set to 'Enabled: Diagnostic data off (not recommended)' or 'Enabled: Send required diagnostic data'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Data Collection and Preview Builds\Allow Diagnostic Data
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The device will send required diagnostic data and the end user can choose whether to send optional diagnostic data from the Settings app.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Disable OneSettings Downloads' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Data Collection and Preview Builds\Disable OneSettings Downloads
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows will periodically attempt to connect with the OneSettings service to download configuration settings.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not show feedback notifications' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Data Collection and Preview Builds\Do not show feedback notifications
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users may see notifications through the Windows Feedback app asking users for feedback. Users can control how often they receive feedback questions.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable OneSettings Auditing' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Data Collection and Preview Builds\Enable OneSettings Auditing
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows will not record attempts to connect with the OneSettings service to the Event Log.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Limit Diagnostic Log Collection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Data Collection and Preview Builds\Limit Diagnostic Log Collection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Microsoft may occasionally collect diagnostic logs if the device has been configured to send optional diagnostic data.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Limit Dump Collection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Data Collection and Preview Builds\Limit Dump Collection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Microsoft may occasionally collect full or heap memory dumps, if sending optional diagnostic data is permitted.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable App Installer Experimental Features' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Desktop App Installer\Enable App Installer Experimental Features
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Users have access to experimental features for the Windows Package Manager.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable App Installer Hash Override' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Desktop App Installer\Enable App Installer Hash Override
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Users can override the SHA256 security validation in the Windows Package Manager settings.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable App Installer Local Archive Malware Scan Override' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Desktop App Installer\Enable App Installer Local Archive Malware Scan Override
rules.default_value: Not configured. (Windows Package Manager administrator settings will be adhered to.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable App Installer ms-appinstaller protocol' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Desktop App Installer\Enable App Installer ms-appinstaller protocol
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Users can install packages from websites that use the `ms-appinstaller` protocol.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable App Installer Microsoft Store Source Certificate Validation Bypass' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Enable App Installer Microsoft Store Source Certificate Validation Bypass
rules.default_value: Not configured. (The Windows Package Manager administrator settings will be adhered to.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Application: Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\Application\Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size
rules.default_value: Disabled. (When a log file reaches its maximum size, new events overwrite old events.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Application: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)' is set to 'Enabled: 32,768 or greater'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\Application\Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The default log size is 20,480 KB - this value can be changed by the local administrator using the Log Properties dialog.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Security: Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\Security\Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size
rules.default_value: Disabled. (When a log file reaches its maximum size, new events overwrite old events.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Security: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)' is set to 'Enabled: 196,608 or greater'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\Security\Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The default log size is 20,480 KB - this value can be changed by the local administrator using the Log Properties dialog.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Setup: Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\Setup\Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size
rules.default_value: Disabled. (When a log file reaches its maximum size, new events overwrite old events.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Setup: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)' is set to 'Enabled: 32,768 or greater'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\Setup\Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The default log size is 20,480 KB - this value can be changed by the local administrator using the Log Properties dialog.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'System: Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\System\Control Event Log behavior when the log file reaches its maximum size
rules.default_value: Disabled. (When a log file reaches its maximum size, new events overwrite old events.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'System: Specify the maximum log file size (KB)' is set to 'Enabled: 32,768 or greater'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Event Log Service\System\Specify the maximum log file size (KB)
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The default log size is 20,480 KB - this value can be changed by the local administrator using the Log Properties dialog.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not apply the Mark of the Web tag to files copied from insecure sources' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\File Explorer\Do not apply the Mark of the Web tag to files copied from insecure sources
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Files copied from unsecure sources will be tagged with the appropriate Mark of the Web.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\File Explorer\Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Data Execution Prevention will block certain types of malware from exploiting Explorer.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off heap termination on corruption' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\File Explorer\Turn off heap termination on corruption
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Heap termination on corruption is enabled.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off shell protocol protected mode' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\File Explorer\Turn off shell protocol protected mode
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The protocol is in the protected mode, allowing applications to only open a limited set of folders.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Block all consumer Microsoft account user authentication' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft accounts\Block all consumer Microsoft account user authentication
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Applications and services on the device will be permitted to authenticate using consumer Microsoft accounts via the Windows `OnlineID` and `WebAccountManager` APIs.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure detection for potentially unwanted applications' is set to 'Enabled: Block'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Configure detection for potentially unwanted applications
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Applications that are identified by Microsoft as PUA will not be blocked.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Control whether exclusions are visible to local users' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Control whether exclusions are visible to local users
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Local users are able to view Microsoft Defender Antivirus exclusions.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable EDR in block mode' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Features\Enable EDR in block mode
rules.default_value: Disabled. (EDR will not run in block mode.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure local setting override for reporting to Microsoft MAPS' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\MAPS\Configure local setting override for reporting to Microsoft MAPS
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Group Policy will take priority over the local preference setting.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Microsoft Defender Exploit Guard\Attack Surface Reduction\Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules
rules.default_value: Disabled. (No ASR rules will be configured.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules: Set the state for each ASR rule' is configured
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Microsoft Defender Exploit Guard\Attack Surface Reduction\Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules: Set the state for each ASR rule
rules.default_value: Disabled. (No ASR rules will be configured.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Prevent users and apps from accessing dangerous websites' is set to 'Enabled: Block'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Microsoft Defender Exploit Guard\Network Protection\Prevent users and apps from accessing dangerous websites
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users and applications will not be blocked from connecting to dangerous domains.)
rules.audit_procedure: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Windows Defender Exploit Guard\Network Protection:EnableNetworkProtection

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Enable file hash computation feature' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\MpEngine\Enable file hash computation feature
rules.default_value: Disabled. (File hash values are not computed during scans.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure real-time protection and Security Intelligence Updates during OOBE' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Real-Time Protection\Configure real-time protection and Security Intelligence Updates during OOBE
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Real-time Protection and Security Intelligence will be updated during OOBE.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Scan all downloaded files and attachments' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Real-Time Protection\Scan all downloaded files and attachments
rules.default_value: Enabled. (All downloaded files and attachments will be scanned.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off real-time protection' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Real-Time Protection\Turn off real-time protection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Microsoft Defender Antivirus will prompt users to take actions on malware detections.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn on behavior monitoring' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Real-Time Protection\Turn on behavior monitoring
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Behavior monitoring will be enabled.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn on script scanning' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Real-Time Protection\Turn on script scanning
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Script scanning will be enabled.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Remote Encryption Protection Mode' is set to 'Enabled: Audit' or higher
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Remediation\Behavioral Network Blocks\Brute-Force Protection\Configure Remote Encryption Protection Mode
rules.default_value: Not configured. (Apply defaults, which can vary depending on the antivirus engine version and the platform.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Scan excluded files and directories during quick scans' is set to 'Enabled: 1'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Scan\Scan excluded files and directories during quick scans
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Contextual exclusions are not scanned during Quick Scans.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Scan packed executables' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Scan\Scan packed executables
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Packed executables will be scanned.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Scan removable drives' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Scan\Scan removable drives
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Removable drives will not be scanned during a full scan. Removable drives may still be scanned during quick scan and custom scan.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Trigger a quick scan after X days without any scans' is set to 'Enabled: 7'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Scan\Trigger a quick scan after X days without any scans
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Aggressive Quick Scans are disabled.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn on e-mail scanning' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Microsoft Defender Antivirus\Scan\Turn on e-mail scanning
rules.default_value: Disabled. (E-mail scanning by Microsoft Defender Antivirus will be disabled.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Prevent the usage of OneDrive for file storage' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\OneDrive\Prevent the usage of OneDrive for file storage
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Apps and features can work with OneDrive file storage using the Next Generation Sync Client.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not allow passwords to be saved' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Connection Client\Do not allow passwords to be saved
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users will be able to save passwords using Remote Desktop Connection.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not allow drive redirection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Device and Resource Redirection\Do not allow drive redirection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (An RD Session Host maps client drives automatically upon connection.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Always prompt for password upon connection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Security\Always prompt for password upon connection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Remote Desktop Services allows users to automatically log on if they enter a password in the Remote Desktop Connection client.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Require secure RPC communication' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Security\Require secure RPC communication
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Remote Desktop Services always requests security for all RPC traffic. However, unsecured communication is allowed for RPC clients that do not respond to the request.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Require use of specific security layer for remote (RDP) connections' is set to 'Enabled: SSL'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Security\Require use of specific security layer for remote (RDP) connections
rules.default_value: Negotiate. (The most secure method that is supported by the client is enforced. If TLS is supported, it is used to authenticate the RD Session Host server. If TLS is not supported, native RDP encryption is used, but the RD Session Host server is not authenticated.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Require user authentication for remote connections by using Network Level Authentication' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Security\Require user authentication for remote connections by using Network Level Authentication
rules.default_value: Windows Server 2008 R2 or older: Disabled. Windows Server 2012 (non-R2) or newer: Enabled.

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Set client connection encryption level' is set to 'Enabled: High Level'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Security\Set client connection encryption level
rules.default_value: Enabled: High Level. (All communications between clients and RD Session Host servers during remote connections using native RDP encryption must be 128-bit strength. Clients that do not support 128-bit encryption will be unable to establish Remote Desktop Server sessions.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not delete temp folders upon exit' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Temporary Folders\Do not delete temp folders upon exit
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Temporary folders are deleted when a user logs off.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not use temporary folders per session' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Temporary Folders\Do not use temporary folders per session
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Per-session temporary folders are created.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Prevent downloading of enclosures' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\RSS Feeds\Prevent downloading of enclosures
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users can set the Feed Sync Engine to download an enclosure through the Feed property page. Developers can change the download setting through the Feed APIs.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\RSS Feeds\Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The Windows RSS Platform will not authenticate to RSS feed servers using the Basic authentication scheme over a less secure HTTP connection.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow indexing of encrypted files' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Search\Allow indexing of encrypted files
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Search service components (including non-Microsoft components) are expected not to index encrypted items or encrypted stores.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Windows Defender SmartScreen' is set to 'Enabled: Warn and prevent bypass'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Defender SmartScreen\Explorer\Configure Windows Defender SmartScreen
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows SmartScreen behavior is managed by administrators on the PC by using Windows SmartScreen Settings in Action Center.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow Windows Ink Workspace' is set to 'Enabled: On, but disallow access above lock' OR 'Enabled: Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Ink Workspace\Allow Windows Ink Workspace
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Windows Ink Workspace is permitted above the lock screen.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow user control over installs' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Installer\Allow user control over installs
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The security features of Windows Installer will prevent users from changing installation options typically reserved for system administrators, such as specifying the directory to which files are installed.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Always install with elevated privileges' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Installer\Always install with elevated privileges
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows Installer will apply the current user's permissions when it installs programs that a system administrator does not distribute or offer. This will prevent standard users from installing applications that affect system-wide configuration items.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure the transmission of the user's password in the content of MPR notifications sent by winlogon.' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Logon Options\Configure the transmission of the user's password in the content of MPR notifications sent by winlogon.
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Winlogon sends MPR notifications with empty password fields of the user's authentication info.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Sign-in and lock last interactive user automatically after a restart' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Logon Options\Sign-in and lock last interactive user automatically after a restart
rules.default_value: Enabled. (The device securely saves the user's credentials (including the user name, domain and encrypted password) to configure automatic sign-in after a Windows Update restart. After the Windows Update restart, the user is automatically signed-in and the session is automatically locked with all the lock screen apps configured for that user.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow Basic authentication' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Client\Allow Basic authentication
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The WinRM client does not use Basic authentication.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow unencrypted traffic' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Client\Allow unencrypted traffic
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The WinRM client sends or receives only encrypted messages over the network.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Disallow Digest authentication' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Client\Disallow Digest authentication
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The WinRM client will use Digest authentication.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow Basic authentication' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Service\Allow Basic authentication
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The WinRM service will not accept Basic authentication from a remote client.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Allow unencrypted traffic' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Service\Allow unencrypted traffic
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The WinRM service sends or receives only encrypted messages over the network.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Disallow WinRM from storing RunAs credentials' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Service\Disallow WinRM from storing RunAs credentials
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The WinRM service will allow the `RunAsUser` and `RunAsPassword` configuration values to be set for plug-ins and the `RunAsPassword` value will be stored securely.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Prevent users from modifying settings' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Security\App and browser protection\Prevent users from modifying settings
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Local users are allowed to make changes in the Exploit protection settings area.)
rules.audit_procedure: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender Security Center\App and Browser protection:DisallowExploitProtectionOverride

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'No auto-restart with logged on users for scheduled automatic updates installations' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Update\Legacy Policies\No auto-restart with logged on users for scheduled automatic updates installations
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Automatic Updates will notify the user that the computer will automatically restart in 5 minutes to complete the installation of security updates.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Automatic Updates' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Update\Manage end user experience\Configure Automatic Updates
rules.default_value: Enabled: 3 - Auto download and notify for install. (Windows finds updates that apply to the computer and downloads them in the background (the user is not notified or interrupted during this process). When the downloads are complete, users will be notified that they are ready to install. After going to Windows Update, users can install them.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Configure Automatic Updates: Scheduled install day' is set to '0 - Every day'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Update\Manage end user experience\Configure Automatic Updates: Scheduled install day
rules.default_value: Not Defined. (Since the default value of Configure Automatic Updates is `3 - Auto download and notify for install`, this setting is not applicable by default.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Manage preview builds' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Update\Manage updates offered from Windows Update\Manage preview builds
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows Update will not offer you any pre-release updates and you will receive such content once released to the world. Disabling this policy will cause any devices currently on a pre-release build to opt out and stay on the latest Feature Update once released.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Select when Preview Builds and Feature Updates are received' is set to 'Enabled: 180 or more days'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Update\Manage updates offered from Windows Update\Select when Preview Builds and Feature Updates are received
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Feature Update cadence will not be enforced by Group Policy.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Select when Quality Updates are received' is set to 'Enabled: 0 days'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Update\Manage updates offered from Windows Update\Select when Quality Updates are received
rules.default_value: Enabled: 0 days. (Install new Quality Updates as soon as they are available.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off toast notifications on the lock screen' is set to 'Enabled'

rules.default_value: Disabled. (Toast notifications on the lock screen are enabled and can be turned off by the administrator or user.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not preserve zone information in file attachments' is set to 'Disabled'

rules.default_value: Enabled. (Windows Spotlight is set as the lock screen provider.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Do not suggest third-party content in Windows spotlight' is set to 'Enabled'

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Turn off Spotlight collection on Desktop' is set to 'Enabled'

rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users can share files out of their user profile after an administrator has opted in the computer.)

rules.title: (L1) Ensure 'Always install with elevated privileges' is set to 'Disabled'

rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows Installer will apply the current user's permissions when it installs programs that a system administrator does not distribute or offer. This will prevent standard users from installing applications that affect system-wide configuration items.)

If the user leaves the session in a disconnected state, the user automatically reconnects to that session at the next logon.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Allow UI Automation redirection' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Device and Resource Redirection\Allow UI Automation redirection
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Any UI Automation clients on the local computer can interact with remote apps.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Do not allow COM port redirection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Device and Resource Redirection\Do not allow COM port redirection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Remote Desktop Services allows COM port redirection.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Do not allow location redirection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Device and Resource Redirection\Do not allow location redirection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users can redirect their location data to the remote computer.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Do not allow LPT port redirection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Device and Resource Redirection\Do not allow LPT port redirection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Remote Desktop Services allows LPT port redirection.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Do not allow supported Plug and Play device redirection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Device and Resource Redirection\Do not allow supported Plug and Play device redirection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Remote Desktop Services allows redirection of supported Plug and Play devices.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Do not allow WebAuthn redirection' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Device and Resource Redirection\Do not allow WebAuthn redirection
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users can use local authenticators inside the Remote Desktop session.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Set time limit for active but idle Remote Desktop Services sessions' is set to 'Enabled: 15 minutes or less, but not Never (0)'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Session Time Limits\Set time limit for active but idle Remote Desktop Services sessions
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Remote Desktop Services allows sessions to remain active but idle for an unlimited amount of time.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Set time limit for disconnected sessions' is set to 'Enabled: 1 minute'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Remote Desktop Services\Remote Desktop Session Host\Session Time Limits\Set time limit for disconnected sessions
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Disconnected Remote Desktop sessions are maintained for an unlimited time on the server.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Allow Cloud Search' is set to 'Enabled: Disable Cloud Search'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Search\Allow Cloud Search
rules.default_value: Enabled: Enable Cloud Search. (Allow search and Cortana to search cloud sources like OneDrive and SharePoint.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Allow search highlights' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Search\Allow search highlights
rules.default_value: Enabled. (Search highlights in the start menu search box and in search home will be available.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Turn off KMS Client Online AVS Validation' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Software Protection Platform\Turn off KMS Client Online AVS Validation
rules.default_value: Disabled. (KMS client activation data will automatically be sent to Microsoft when the device activates.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Allow suggested apps in Windows Ink Workspace' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Ink Workspace\Allow suggested apps in Windows Ink Workspace
rules.default_value: Enabled. (The suggested apps in Windows Ink Workspace will be allowed.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Installer\Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts
rules.default_value: Disabled. (When a script hosted by an Internet browser tries to install a program on the system, the system warns users and allows them to select or refuse the installation.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Turn on PowerShell Script Block Logging' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows PowerShell\Turn on PowerShell Script Block Logging
rules.default_value: Enabled. (PowerShell will log script blocks the first time they are used.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Turn on PowerShell Transcription' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows PowerShell\Turn on PowerShell Transcription
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Transcription of PowerShell-based applications is disabled by default, although transcription can still be enabled through the `Start-Transcript` cmdlet.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Allow remote server management through WinRM' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Service\Allow remote server management through WinRM
rules.default_value: Disabled. (The WinRM service will not respond to requests from a remote computer, regardless of whether or not any WinRM listeners are configured.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Allow Remote Shell Access' is set to 'Disabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: Computer Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Shell\Allow Remote Shell Access
rules.default_value: Enabled. (New Remote Shell connections are allowed.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Turn off Help Experience Improvement Program' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: User Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\System\Internet Communication Management\Internet Communication Settings\Turn off Help Experience Improvement Program
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Users can turn on the Help Experience Improvement program feature from the Help and Support settings page.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Do not use diagnostic data for tailored experiences' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: User Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Cloud Content\Do not use diagnostic data for tailored experiences
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Microsoft will use diagnostic data to provide personalized recommendations, tips and offers.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Turn off all Windows spotlight features' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.remediation_procedure: User Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Cloud Content\Turn off all Windows spotlight features
rules.default_value: Disabled. (Windows Spotlight features are allowed.)

rules.title: (L2) Ensure 'Prevent Codec Download' is set to 'Enabled'
rules.expected_value: Users can change the setting for the _Download codecs automatically_ check box
rules.remediation_procedure: User Configuration\Policies\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Media Player\Playback\Prevent Codec Download
rules.default_value: Users can change the setting for the _Download codecs automatically_ check box.
